intro: Brachyscome spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of broad, spoon-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring and are followed by fluffy seed heads that disperse easily by wind. Brachyscome spathulata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments.
